properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 10 at 4:53AM PST until January 11 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...HEAVY SNOW TODAY...

.A potent winter storm will move into the Inland Northwest
Friday. Light snow will begin in the morning hours on Friday with
snow intensity increasing Friday afternoon and night.  Snow
showers will linger through Saturday.

* WHAT...Heavy snow for The Cascade Crest including Highway 2
between Coles Corner and Stevens Pass. Additional snow
accumulations of 7 to 16 inches with amounts near two feet
closer to the crest. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph.

* WHERE...Mazama, Stehekin, Plain, and Holden Village.

* WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas
of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening
commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lower valleys will also experience
accumulating snow with 3 to 6 inches likely for the lower
Wenatchee, Entiat and Methow River valleys.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST SATURDAY FOR THE CASCADE CREST INCLUDING HIGHWAY 2 BETWEEN COLES CORNER AND STEVENS PASS
